intro: Serapias brundisina, commonly known as the Brindisi orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange with contrasting purple or red markings, and it blooms during the spring season. Serapias brundisina is a perennial herb that produces a rosette of basal leaves and a single flowering stem.
